alert.note: Alert for Estancia Valley; Jemez Mountains; Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; Santa Fe Metro Area; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 5:47PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...DRY MICROBURST WINDS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EAST CENTRAL CIBOLA, NORTHERN VALENCIA, SOUTHEASTERN SANDOVAL, SOUTHWESTERN SANTA FE, BERNALILLO AND NORTHWESTERN TORRANCE COUNTIES THROUGH 645 PM MDT... At 543 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong microburst winds, blowing dust, and very light rain along a line extending from 13 miles east of Mesita to Albuquerque, Carnuel and Sedillo. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Albuquerque, Rio Rancho, Valencia, Los Lunas, Corrales, Bernalillo, Belen, Los Ranchos De Albuquerque, Bosque Farms and Edgewood. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 127 and 198. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 196 and 254. Highway 285 near Mile Marker 281. Highway 550 between Mile Markers 1 and 12. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Blowing dust associated with strong microburst winds can reduce visibilities below one quarter mile at times.

area.areaDesc: Estancia Valley; Jemez Mountains; Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; Santa Fe Metro Area; West Central Highlands
